name: State Education Assistance Program (SEAP)
description: Idaho National Guard members receive up to $8,000 per state fiscal year for tuition and registration fees at ANY Idaho institution (public or private). Must exhaust federal TA first. Can be used WITH GI Bill simultaneously. Enlisted non-technician members only. No time limit, credit hour limit, or degree level limit - use for as long as needed for any degree/certificate. Available for vocational certifications (pilot, hairstyling, welding, etc.).
eligibility: Idaho National Guard member (Army or Air)
Active drilling, non-technician (state/federal technicians excluded by state law)
Cannot use federal TA and SEAP for same class
CAN use GI Bill and SEAP simultaneously
benefit_amount: Up to $8,000/state fiscal year (tuition + registration fees)
how_to_apply: Contact Idaho National Guard Education Office for required brief before applying (208) 272-3612

name: Armed Forces/Public Safety Officer Dependent Scholarship
description: Children and spouses of Idaho military members killed on duty OR disabled to point of unemployability receive: FREE tuition + fees (up to 4 academic years), $750/semester for books, campus housing, AND subsistence. Must be Idaho resident undergraduate.
eligibility: Child or spouse of Idaho military member
Parent/spouse killed on duty OR disabled to point of unemployability
benefit_amount: FREE tuition + fees + $750/semester books + housing + subsistence
how_to_apply: Apply through Idaho State Board of Education

name: In-State Tuition for Military and Veterans
description: In-state tuition rates available for: Idaho resident military stationed outside Idaho OR military/family stationed IN Idaho OR Idaho National Guard/family OR honorably discharged after 2+ years service (apply within 1 year) OR listed Idaho as home of record when serving/separating.
eligibility: Idaho resident military stationed out OR
Honorable discharge 2+ years (apply within 1 year) OR
benefit_amount: In-state tuition rates (saves $10,000-$15,000/year)
how_to_apply: Contact Registrar's office of Idaho institution

name: Veterans Property Tax Reduction ($1,500) - 100% Permanent
description: Veterans with 100% service-connected PERMANENT AND TOTAL disability receive up to $1,500 reduction in property taxes on home + 1 acre. No income limit. Once approved, automatically renews - NO annual reapplication required. Surviving spouse can continue benefit if unremarried.
eligibility: Own and occupy Idaho primary residence
benefit_amount: Up to $1,500 property tax reduction (auto-renews)
how_to_apply: Apply online at tax.idaho.gov/ptr or County Assessor January 1-April 15 (one-time application)

name: Veterans Property Tax Reduction ($1,500) - 100% Temporary
description: Veterans with 100% service-connected disability OR 100% IU (individual unemployability) receive up to $1,500 reduction in property taxes on home + 1 acre. No income limit. Must reapply annually if disability is NOT permanent. Surviving spouse can continue benefit if unremarried.
eligibility: Own and occupy Idaho primary residence before April 15
benefit_amount: Up to $1,500 property tax reduction (annual application required)
how_to_apply: Apply online at tax.idaho.gov/ptr or County Assessor January 1-April 15 annually

name: Property Tax Reduction (10%-90% Disability - Income Based)
description: Veterans with 10%-90% service-connected disability (OR receiving VA pension for non-service disability) qualify for 'Circuit Breaker' property tax reduction when meeting residency and income requirements. Income limit approximately $37,810 (2024). Reduction up to $1,500.
eligibility: 10%-90% service-connected disability OR VA non-service pension
Own and occupy Idaho primary residence
benefit_amount: Up to $1,500 reduction (income-based, sliding scale)
how_to_apply: Apply online at tax.idaho.gov/ptr or County Assessor January 1-April 15 annually

name: Military Pay Tax Exemption (Stationed Outside 120+ Days)
description: Idaho resident service members stationed OUTSIDE Idaho for 120+ continuous days are EXEMPT from Idaho state income tax on military pay. Military pay for Idaho residents stationed IN Idaho IS taxable.
eligibility: Stationed outside Idaho for continuous 120+ days
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on military pay (if outside Idaho 120+ days)
how_to_apply: Exclude from Idaho income tax return if stationed outside 120+ days

name: Military Retirement Pay Tax Exemption (Age 65+)
description: Military retirement pay is 100% EXEMPT from Idaho state income tax for retirees age 65+ OR disabled retirees age 62+. Also available to unremarried surviving spouses.
eligibility: Idaho resident receiving military retirement pay
OR unremarried surviving spouse meeting age requirements
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on military retirement pay
how_to_apply: Exclude from Idaho income tax return

name: Survivor Benefit Plan (SBP) Tax Exemption
description: SBP/RCSBP/RSFPP payments are 100% tax-free for recipients age 65+ OR disabled and age 62+. Also available to unremarried surviving spouses meeting age requirements.
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on survivor benefit payments
how_to_apply: Exclude from Idaho income tax return

name: Military Spouse Income Tax Exemption
description: Military spouse's earned income is NOT subject to Idaho income tax if: married to service member serving in Idaho, service member registered with another state as home of record, moved to Idaho with service member, and same permanent residence. Spouse files Idaho Form ID-MS1 with employer.
eligibility: Married to service member serving in Idaho
Service member has different state as home of record
Moved to Idaho with service member
Same permanent residence as service member
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on spouse's earned income in Idaho
how_to_apply: File Idaho Form ID-MS1 with employer

name: Grocery Tax Credit (Age 65+ or Disabled 62+)
description: Veterans age 65+ OR disabled age 62+ may claim Idaho Grocery Tax Credit even when not required to file income tax return if VA disability benefits are only income.
eligibility: VA disability benefits may be only income
benefit_amount: Grocery tax credit (amount varies)
how_to_apply: File for grocery credit on Idaho tax forms

name: Veterans Employment Preference (5 or 10 Points)
description: Honorably discharged veterans receive 5 preference points on state employment exams (initial hire only). Disabled veterans (10%+ service-connected disability) OR Purple Heart recipients receive 10 points. Surviving spouse of preference-eligible veteran (unmarried) also receives 10 points. Veterans with 30%+ disability guaranteed interview if in top 25 qualified applicants.
eligibility: Idaho resident veteran, honorably discharged (5 points)
benefit_amount: 5 or 10 preference points + interview guarantee (30%+ disability)
how_to_apply: Indicate veteran status on state job applications with DD-214

name: Late Employment Application (Recent Discharge/Hospitalization)
description: Recently discharged military personnel undergoing service-connected hospitalization (up to 1 year after discharge) may file application for ANY classified Idaho position that has already closed. Application must be filed within 120 days of discharge or hospitalization.
benefit_amount: Ability to apply for closed positions
how_to_apply: File application within 120 days even if position closed

name: Military Experience for Occupational Licensing
description: Military members and families receive: expedited processing for occupational licenses, credit for military training relevant to license/registration. Idaho residents on active/reserve/Guard duty do NOT pay professional/occupational license or renewal fees while in military. License expiration extended 6 months after leaving service.
eligibility: Idaho resident military member or family
benefit_amount: Expedited licensing + military training credit + FREE license fees + 6-month extension
how_to_apply: Contact relevant Idaho licensing board with military credentials
source_name: Idaho Division of Occupational and Professional Licenses

name: Idaho Military Legal Alliance (IMLA)
description: Coordinates pro bono legal services for Idaho's military population. Provides legal education on military legal issues, supports military legal clinics, and recruits pro bono attorneys for service members.
benefit_amount: FREE pro bono legal services and education
how_to_apply: Contact Idaho Military Legal Alliance

name: $5.75 Resident Disabled Veteran Hunting/Fishing License
description: Idaho resident veterans with 40%+ service-connected disability receive $5.75 Disabled American Veteran (DAV) combo hunting/fishing license. Allows purchase of reduced-fee tags: deer ($10.75), elk ($16.50), bear ($6.75), turkey ($10.75). Archery/muzzleloader permits $3.75 each. Documentation required for first issuance only.
eligibility: VA Benefits Summary Letter (first time only)
benefit_amount: $5.75 license + reduced tags (deer $10.75, elk $16.50, bear $6.75, turkey $10.75)
how_to_apply: Apply at Idaho Fish and Game office with VA letter (first time) or online (renewals)
source_name: Idaho Department of Fish and Game

name: $31.75 Nonresident Disabled Veteran Hunting/Fishing License
description: Nonresident disabled veterans (40%+ service-connected) receive $31.75 DAV hunting + 3-day fishing license. Allows reduced-fee nonresident tags: deer ($23.75), elk ($39.75), bear ($23.75), turkey ($19.75). Archery/muzzleloader $5.75 each. Limited to 500 deer tags, 300 elk tags.
benefit_amount: $31.75 license + reduced nonresident tags (saves $100-$200 vs regular nonresident)
how_to_apply: Apply at Idaho Fish and Game regional office or mail VA letter to PO Box 25, Boise ID 83707
source_name: Idaho Department of Fish and Game

name: Disabled Veterans Special Big Game Tag Program (5 FREE Tags)
description: Five FREE big game hunt tags available annually for disabled veterans. Tags eligible for deer, elk, pronghorn, moose, black bear, or mountain lion (except controlled hunts with <5 tags). Participants exempt from licensing requirements. Once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. Application January 2-31.
eligibility: Idaho Division of Veterans Services screens and prioritizes
benefit_amount: FREE big game tag (deer/elk/pronghorn/moose/bear/lion) + exempt from licensing
how_to_apply: Apply January 2-31 through Idaho Division of Veterans Services
source_name: Idaho Department of Fish and Game / Idaho Division of Veterans Services

name: Reduced Hunting/Fishing License for Idaho Residents on Leave
description: Service members whose official home of record is Idaho and stationed outside Idaho can purchase hunting/fishing licenses at reduced fee during leave. Must provide Leave and Earnings Statement + leave papers.
benefit_amount: Reduced fee hunting/fishing licenses (on leave)
how_to_apply: Present Leave and Earnings Statement + leave papers when purchasing
source_name: Idaho Department of Fish and Game

name: Resident Rates for Nonresident Military (30+ Days)
description: Nonresident service members and dependents stationed in Idaho for 30+ days may purchase Idaho hunting/fishing licenses and tags at RESIDENT prices.
benefit_amount: Resident license pricing (saves $100-$300 vs nonresident)
how_to_apply: Present military ID at Idaho Fish and Game office
source_name: Idaho Department of Fish and Game

name: License/Tag Refund or Rain Check (Deployment)
description: Service members deploying for contingency operations can receive refund OR rain check for hunting licenses/tags/permits unable to use due to deployment.
benefit_amount: Refund or rain check for unused licenses/tags
how_to_apply: Request at Idaho Fish and Game regional office or mail Affidavit for Refund form
source_name: Idaho Department of Fish and Game

name: FREE State Parks Camping and Day-Use (100% Disabled)
description: Idaho veterans with 100% VA disability rating receive FREE campsite while camping in Idaho state parks AND FREE day-use access to all Idaho state parks.
benefit_amount: FREE state park camping + FREE day-use access
how_to_apply: Present VA documentation at Idaho State Parks

name: Special Veteran License Plates
description: Multiple veteran plate options: 'Veteran' (no conflict), WWII, Korea, Vietnam, Persian Gulf, Afghanistan/Iraq (post-9/11), Gold Star Family. Disabled Veteran and Disabled Veteran Purple Heart plates available FREE for 100% permanent disabled OR Purple Heart recipients qualifying for disabled veteran fee exemption. POW and Medal of Honor recipients contact ITD Special Plates (208) 334-8649.
eligibility: FREE for 100% P&T or Purple Heart (if qualifying)
benefit_amount: FREE or standard fee specialty plates
how_to_apply: Apply at Idaho DMV Online Services or county office

name: Veteran Designation on Driver's License/ID
description: Veterans can add 'veteran' designation to Idaho driver's license or state ID. No charge when added to new or renewed license/ID. $15 duplicate card fee to add designation at any other time. Designation is permanent.
eligibility: Valid documentation showing proof of honorable discharge (DD-214)
benefit_amount: Veteran designation (FREE at renewal, $15 duplicate fee otherwise)
how_to_apply: Present DD-214 at Idaho DMV when renewing or requesting duplicate

name: Idaho National Guard Workers Compensation
description: Idaho National Guard members who become sick or injured in line of duty may be covered under Idaho Workers Compensation laws if on state active duty AND qualify for Worker's Compensation. Prevents duplicate payments from other programs.
eligibility: Sick or injured in line of duty
benefit_amount: Workers Compensation medical coverage
how_to_apply: Contact Idaho National Guard and Idaho Workers Compensation

name: Idaho State Veterans Cemeteries (2 Locations)
description: Two state veterans cemeteries in Blackfoot and Boise. Eligibility same as federal VA cemeteries. No Idaho residency requirement. FREE burial for eligible veterans and dependents.
benefit_amount: FREE burial services
how_to_apply: Contact Idaho State Veterans Cemetery in Blackfoot or Boise
